From The Bold and The Beautiful:

What makes JOWEN work? Daytime has finally gotten it right. While older men have been seducing and romancing younger women for decades, soaps have treated older women involved with younger men as desperate and emotionally weak women who cling to men who could never really love them. Older women have served as bedmates and bank accounts to their younger lovers and little else (AMCâ€™s Marian and Tad, ATWTâ€™s Lucinda and Craig, for example). Jackie Marone is a woman who is vivacious, seductive, and powerful. Sheâ€™s also in charge of her emotions and her bank account. Owen is with her because he loves her, not because she pays for him. I was most proud of the moment when Jackie realized that not even for Owen was she willing to attempt to become a mother again. She was well on her way to becoming a grandmother and expected Owen to be the man he said he was when he married her â€“ not someone whoâ€™d suddenly developed a passion for parenting. She held firm to her desire to enjoy life and be the woman sheâ€™d always wanted to be and Owen realized that loving her was his only real passion.

What does JOWEN helps me forget? Pretty much all of the rest of the BnB â€“ emasculated Forrester males genuflecting before their bitter ex-wives, the Forrester family penchant for pimping their young (my 20 something kid canâ€™t come home with spare change in his pocket without explaining where it came from â€“ Steffy brings home a multimillioin dollar company that no one else could win back and everyone celebrates?). Jowen helps me forget the inconsistency in writing â€“ Stephanie Forrester is now a â€˜heroineâ€™ for â€˜savingâ€™ the company she gleefully helped Bill Spencer destroy? JOWEN helps me forget the new lie that the Logans have â€˜ruinedâ€™ FC when even Steffy bragged about how the company made money hand over fist thanks to the â€˜Royaltyâ€™ collection beating out the JMâ€™s â€˜Indulgeâ€™ line. JOWEN even helps me forget that the writers have been trying to find a place to force Sarah Brownâ€™s â€œSandy/Aggieâ€ (Saggie) to fit and are undoing months/years of great work in the process. In the end, even if Nick doesnâ€™t end up with Sags â€“ everything will have been undone for no reason at all.

From General Hopsital:

What makes Mac and Alexis work? Despite Alexisâ€™ lapse of sanity leading her to sleep with Sonny Corinthos, both Mac and Alexis have both maintained their integrity in the long term. Thereâ€™s something so likable about both characters that the combined effect of their presence pushes my happy meter off the charts! The writers have picked up on whatever the genuine quality is that John J. York and Nancy Lee Grahn lend to their lovelorn, law and order loving characters. Scenes with Mac and Alexis tend to be a mixture of being sweet and funny. While the couple doesnâ€™t get nearly the screen time they deserve, they make you grateful for the screen time theyâ€™ve been given. If the writers ever figure out that we need less of the doom and gloom, and more of the â€˜heeeeyyyyyyâ€™, this show could be on to something HUGE. Iâ€™m most looking forward to the possiblity of Mac and Alexis bringing their families together -and opening the Scorpio home once again. Kristina and Molly would have a father/stepfather they could respect. Kristina, especially, shows promise of joining Robin in being the future of soap heroines on a show that desperately needs them. To have the Scorpio-Drake-Davis clans coming together could just give us the â€˜balanceâ€™ this show has been lacking.

What does the Mac and Alexis pairing make me forget? Other than Scrubs, Maxelli, and the powerhouse acting of JJâ€™s Lucky and RHâ€™s Lizâ€¦ pretty much everything elseâ€¦ the soapgods have been good to me.

From the Days of Our Lives:

What makes Rafe and Sami work? What DOESNâ€™T work about this couple? Iâ€™ve been cautiously optimistic about Rafe and Sami. Iâ€™m an old Lumi fan. No one knows like a Lumi fan how Sami is capable of throwing real love away for the horror of a relationship with a man like EJ. Rafe is one of the few men in Samiâ€™s life (Lucas included) who actually loves her and wants nothing in return. The writers have sold me on the idea that Rafe is the man who would love Sami even if she didnâ€™t love him in return, and would never stop fighting for whatâ€™s in her best interest. With a man like EJ, loving her if she didnâ€™t love him in return would mean forcing himself on her. With a man like Rafe? It means loving her from afar, protecting her at all costs, and laying his life on the line because the thought of a world without her in it is something he just couldnâ€™t bear. Iâ€™m SOLD! Count me in as a â€˜SAFEâ€™ fan!

AS IF thatâ€™s all DAYS had to offer:

What makes the Phillip/Melanie/Nathan triangle work? Each potential pairing impacts me as a viewer in different ways. Why does Phillip even deserve a second chance? If you made it to 7:40 into the video, youâ€™d hear Phillip say, as part of his vows, that if sheâ€™d said that he was going to marry her about a year ago, he would have told her she was crazyâ€¦ BINGO! Thatâ€™s the Phillip Iâ€™ve hated while Mel loved him. Thatâ€™s the man who always thought he was too good for her and that she was nothing more than a consolation prize whenever he lost â€˜the good girlâ€™ (Stephanie). Mel, in return, admits to loving him from the beginning. Despite the lopsided relationship they share, this is a couple with HEAT! They are moths to a flame, and itâ€™s hard not to watch when theyâ€™re together. Mel and Nathan on the other hand? What a delicious redux of Mel and Nicky. This time, the smart and â€˜geekyâ€™ guy should win. Melanie and Nathan remind me a great deal of Sami and Rafe. Nathan is a man who knows Melanie at her core, and loves who she is â€“ warts and all. This triangle works because it seems possible for Melanie to be happy with either. In the end, I have to give the edge to Nathan. I tend to root for the good guy, and heaven knows that in soapdom, the good guy is always the underdog.

What do Sami and Rafe as well as this triangle help me forget? Bo and Carly. Carlyâ€™s incessant whining. Hope being destroyed to try to force Bo and Carly. Carly and Daniel (See where this is going?) Thatâ€™s about it, thoughâ€¦ everything else about DAYS simply ROCKS!

One Life to Live

While Iâ€™m generally not a fan of rap, something about Snoop is AMAZING and I love to see most of the cast together enjoying themselves and allowing us to enjoy them, the show, and this performance.

*YnRâ€™s NuMalcolm? Not workinâ€™. Iâ€™m trying, folks, I really am, but as good as it is to see Darius McCrary on screen again, this was just the wrong role to cast him in. Thoughâ€¦ given the choice between keeping him as Malcolm and keeping KCâ€™s Lily, he wins hands down! Malcolm Winters was an iconic character and unfortunately, McCraryâ€™s interpretation falls flat. Iâ€™ve seen McCraryâ€™s work in other projects (including CBSâ€™s Cold Case) and heâ€™s been very good. Something about this role just doesnâ€™t seem to translate well for the actor.

* If GHâ€™s â€œFrancoâ€ came to town because heâ€™s totally obsessed with Jason:

1. Why was it necessary to have Maxie pimped out and risk her relationship with Spinelli? His focus has been Jason the entire time. The side story involving Maxie just doesnâ€™t make sense and seems to be an awful waste of a couple (Maxelli) and a character (Franco). It served no purpose.

2. How can Jason be considered a â€˜good guyâ€™ when his actions capture the imagination of a â€˜psychoticâ€™ killer? Jasonâ€™s murderous exploits have made him an international icon for blood thirsty criminals? Some hero!

3. Why didnâ€™t TPTB just name him Franco Guza? It would make sense of Francoâ€™s obsession with Jason and the Suckpranos. It would have felt more honest. Itâ€™s art, seemingly, imitating life.

* Why arenâ€™t the BnBâ€s Logan women allowed to confront sister Katie with her penchant for betraying her family for the love of her latest squeeze? * Does anyone else think that ATWTâ€™s Simon and Henry would make a far hotter couple than Luke and Noah? Iâ€™m so tired of the on-again-off-again nature of the Nuke relationship that Iâ€™m ready to see ATWTâ€™s PTB replace them, NOW. Pay attention ATWTâ€™s writers. OLTLâ€™s writers are separating the men from the boys and writing a real relationship between two characters â€“ who just happen to be gay. Watch and learnâ€¦ Speaking of OLTL:

* Why the hell did OLTLâ€™s Bo hand Dorian back the only piece of evidence that could convict his niece of stabbing Mitch Laurence? Was that supposed to be a sign of his honesty and integrity? It felt more like evidence of his sheer stupidity, especially since itâ€™s becoming painfully clear to others that Dorian is Mitchâ€™s puppet.

As for Dorian Lord, she is nothing if not devious. Iâ€™m not too thrilled with the image of a helpless Dorian Lord constantly caving in to Mitchâ€™s demands. At what point does she put her years of mischief-making to use and takes Mitch down? Iâ€™m shocked by the fact that I like seeing Dorian on top, Mayor and chief power broker in Llanview, but I do. Why have that ruined by having her behave like a skittish child, jumping at the sight of her own shadow? MORE kick-ass Dorian, LESS kiss-ass Dorian, please.

* Doesnâ€™t anyone else ever get tired of hearing the BnBâ€™s taylor whine about how Brooke stole her life, and made her miserable? Even I can agree with her that that situation with Jack was traumatic. I sure as hell wouldnâ€™t have wanted to give birth to the biological child of a woman I hated. Taylor didnâ€™t sign on to be a surrogate. She had in vitro in order to have a family with Nick. The child she carried was supposed to be HER child. I get it, but the problem with her whining is that Brooke didnâ€™t cause taylor to â€˜loseâ€™ her son. Taylor chose to give him away. She also chose to continue to try to compete with Brooke for Ridge â€“ even when Ridge made it CLEAR that it was Brooke he loved. You canâ€™t ask the woman to stay out of your life, and then constantly throw yourself in the middle of her life and call yourself a victim.

* Why do DAYS writers continue to make my skin crawl by having EJ touch Sami? Yes, yesâ€¦ he was only comforting her after she received a call from Sydneyâ€™s kidnapperâ€¦. itâ€™s just that every time he goes near her, I see him holding her at gunpoint. I hear him telling her that the only way to save Lucas is to let him violate her. Every touch makes my skin crawl. Has Sami forgotten how she ended up pregnant with EJâ€™s spawn (cutie that she is) and the one before her? Her confused â€˜feelingsâ€™ are degrading and humiliating to watch, speaking as a woman.

Hey, if the actor involved can admit it was rape (comment below from a James Scott interview),

I would be lying if I said I didnâ€™t worry about my future on the soap. I donâ€™t think they handled the rape very well, and Iâ€™ll tell you why. EJ raped Sami, and then afterwards, heâ€™s hanging out in her house â€” alone with her. Itâ€™s irresponsible on so many levels. However, had it been handled well, I think it would have been an interesting story choice. Now the story focus has shifted to her pregnancy and the classic soap story of paternity. Having said that, I chose to believe that EJ is in love with Samantha â€” he just canâ€™t communicate it.

and TPTB can admit it was rape, it was RAPE. He forced her to have sex with him to save the life of the man she loved. You can read a decidedly pro EJami Wikipedia entry with Scottâ€™s comments HERE (that is until someone decides to try to delete the comment).

As for DAYS increasingly dwindling ratings fortunes, is it any wonder that the new focus on Sami and EJ is linked to a rather rapid ratings slide for the show? Good luck selling Ej and Sami as anything other than what they really are: a victim and her obsessive, stalking, rapist.

* For most of the year (plus), All My Children has been largely unwatchable. Color me surprised when I got gooey and nostalgic for Hayley and Mateoâ€™s return (more Hayley than Mateo). Watching Adam soften while talking with Hayley and joke about knowing something about raising â€˜difficult childrenâ€™ was the most priceless moment of that episode for me â€“ Hayley of the dyed dark punk rock hair, now a mother with a wild child of her own. I thought about Brian Bodine, Uncle Pork Chop (Trevor), Natalie down the well, Janet from another Planet, Adamâ€™s dark dark days (which really were different from just his â€˜darkâ€™ days), Stuart and Cindy, scheming Arlene Vaughn, the Santos family â€“ even preachy mom and dad, Edmund and Maria, Erica and Dimitri, Bad girl Kendall and sweetheart Del Cooney, The Martin clan, Jeremy, Laurel and her brother Michael, Cliff and Nina, Palmer and Daisy, The Montgomery Brothers and their feud, Brooke English, Phoebe and Langley, Chuck and Tara, Beloved Mona and Myrtle, Ellen and Devon, Mark Dalton, Tom and Sean Cudahy, and so much moreâ€¦ sheesh). I know that not all of the above mentioned characters were on screen at the same time but just those few moments with Adam and Hayley opened a stream of AMC consciousness and I felt warm all over. I miss All my Children â€“ the real All my Children.

* At some point, BnBâ€™s Brooke Loganâ€™s children are going to have to acknowledge (or learn) that there was NO WAR between their mother and Stephanie Douglas. Stephanie has been on the attack against Brooke almost from the moment she met her. Brooke has tried in vain to make peace and keep peace. Brooke does not seek Stephanie out to hurt her or make her miserable as Stephanie has done with her. Brooke hasnâ€™t made a point of trying t0 publicly expose Stephanie for whatever her wrongdoings are â€“ and there are many. Brooke hasnâ€™t tried to turn Stephanieâ€™s children against her, as Stephanie has tried to do with Brookeâ€™s children.

To allow Brookeâ€™s children to continue to think of Stephanie as â€˜humanâ€™ feels like one of the daytimeâ€™s biggest lies. Theirs has been daytimeâ€™s biggest farce of a rivalry. A rivalry would require TWO participants. It would require balance. It has neither. In any other galaxy, Stephanie would be acknowledged as the psychotic villainess -bully sheâ€™s always been. Calling Stephanie a victim of Brookeâ€™s would be the same as calling GHâ€™s Helena Cassadine a victim of Alexis Davisâ€¦ Hels only slit Alexisâ€™ motherâ€™s throat in front of her when she was a child and threatened her life every single day from that moment on. The warm and toasty moments between Brookeâ€™s children and the dragon lady leaves me switching channels. When a crazed bee-yotch hands your mother an unregisted gun, while wearing white gloves, and tries to get her to take her life, sheâ€™s not your friend. Sheâ€™s not like a mother to you, sheâ€™s not human. When that same woman facilitates your motherâ€™s rape, youâ€™re not suposed to ask her to be a part of your childrenâ€™s lives. Come on BnB writers, get a grip.

Women in daytime = whores. At least, I think theyâ€™re the same. I dunno. Itâ€™s hard for me to figure it all out since Iâ€™m just a woman. Either Iâ€™ve been watching too much daytime or itâ€™s the peyoteâ€¦ (just kidding on the last part, though given what some shows are doing to daytime women and viewers as a consequence, a little peyote might make daytime shows go down a little easier).

General Hospital

Iâ€™m all about the â€˜I told you soâ€™ lately and I want to hand one out to the writers of GH. Iâ€™ve never been impressed with the casting of James Franco in the role of â€˜Francoâ€™ and have been horrified by the drooling and self-congratulating linked to the casting of JF in the role. The fact that the character was named Franco was enough to tell me about the lack of creativity attached his development. It seemed to be all about stunt casting and the hope that a primetime/big screen actor could save GH from falling ratings.

It feels as if GHâ€™s PTB were so convinced that negative stereotypes about daytime viewers were real, the stereotype that weâ€™re just a bunch of sex-starved panty-clinching rubes, who lick our screens whenever a hot male actor is featured, that casting JF as â€˜Francoâ€™ made sense! As if we donâ€™t already have enough testosterone filled doom and gloom on screen! (As for that screen licking part, I freely admit that I do think about licking the screen when Jason Thompsonâ€™s Patrick is on, but hell, who doesnâ€™t?) The idea that â€œFrancoâ€ would cause us to swoon was as big a fallacy as almost everything else the GH writers have offered us by way of propping the Suckpranos storyline. Give Olivia her brain back. She was such a strong vibrant character for so long and now sheâ€™s a walking-talking mess. All the daydreaming about Sonny makes me ill. If I had to worry about Sonny putting a bullet in my kidâ€™s head because my kid was a cop working to make the world safe? STOP! IT!

Quit making Carly an idiot who treats Jaxâ€™s child as Sonnyâ€™s future â€˜kidnapped baitâ€™ child. Itâ€™s disgusting. Notice that when Carly was listing off the children who were protected by Sonnyâ€™s grace, she included Josslyn, and not Molly? STOP IT!

Quit making me feel sorry for Rebecca â€œNotEmilyâ€ Shaw by having her actually be the voice of logic and reason before you ship her off. I really resent you for this one, GH writers. Iâ€™m an avowed â€˜Remilyâ€™ hater and to leave me cheering for her is one of your worse offenses, yet. Even still, I grew tired of the â€œLiz is a slutâ€™ mantra she had going â€“ not that I disagree with the sentiment, just the constant expression of it. The sendoff for Rebecca, the Emily- clone was perfect, by having her make friends with a Zander cloneâ€¦ Chad Brannon was pretty darned delicious looking. Maxie, Maxie, Maxieâ€¦ REALLY? Sheâ€™s gives herself to Franco for the sake of getting him to agree to help her out professionally? Then she tries to pimp out Spinelli to make herself feel better? Maxelli, Scrubs Love, and Jax and Carly were the only interesting things GH had going in its favor and the writers are slowly dismantling all three. Speaking ofâ€¦

For the love of all thatâ€™s soap-holyâ€¦ give me a Scrubs storyline that has nothing to do with old girlfriends crawling out of the woodwork! Yeah, yeahâ€¦ Patrick puts it on â€™emâ€¦ they canâ€™t get enoughâ€¦ once you go Patrick, you never go backâ€¦ Even though I can believe that his arrogant aloof treatment of women made them want him more, Iâ€™m getting tired of women who are attracted to him on that basis. The writers made the courageous decision to make him a happy family man, now I wish theyâ€™d make the courageous decision to create family driven storytelling around the Scorpio-Drake clan. What makes Patrick attractive is that heâ€™s a man who loves his wife and child. Having him betray them would destroy that. Leave something thatâ€™s still a little pure and just for us.

Iâ€™d love it if the GH powers that be would stop treating women (onscreen) like a bunch of â€˜spare partsâ€™ waiting to be traded by GH males, as theyâ€™re needed. Bringing on stellar actors like James Franco canâ€™t cover the holes in plots, the obsession with the dark arts of the mob boys, or the weak female characters who arenâ€™t just damaged- theyâ€™re damned deranged. Treating your viewers like sex-starved fiends whoâ€™ll gladly buy what youâ€™re selling wonâ€™t help either. So why am I still watching? I donâ€™t think soap fans like me want too much. We just want a balance. How about 2 smart women for every woman who is lobotomized for the sake of the dark storylines? One Life to Live

Nora Buchanan. Nora is the woman who slept with her ex, Sam Rappaport, and passed his child off as her husband Boâ€™s child. Even better is the fact that she did it for Boâ€“ whose son was recently killed. That was the rationalization she gave for betraying her husband, she most saintedly did it FOR his sake â€“ all the while knowing that Sam was deeply in love with her and knowing what the emotionally fallout might be. Fortunately (or unfortunately) for all involved, after Bo and Samâ€™s deep pain, it turns out that Matthew was Boâ€™s son after all. Now we have Nora, whoâ€™d been warned/pleaded with/begged not to marry Clint because she didnâ€™t really love him, has now left Clint to be with Bo â€“ during a dark time in Clintâ€™s life.

Once again, another ABC male refers to the cheating lying woman who betrayed him as a whore â€“ I can understand Clintâ€™s rage and his willingness to throw Noraâ€™s past in her face.. I just wish I hadnâ€™t already been overwhelmed with the use of the word â€˜whoreâ€™ from almost every other ABC male before that. Noraâ€™s reaction was still priceless. Sheâ€™s rude and judgmental and has made a habit of telling others why theyâ€™re so unworthy of being loved or trusted. She was stunned that anyone would dare give her the same treatment. I wasnâ€™t crazy about Clintâ€™s choice of words, but Iâ€™m glad that the writers finally allowed someone to point out to Nora what a hypocrite she is.

True to form, Nora didnâ€™t let a little thing like the truth stop her from being who she is. A full scene later, SHE referred to Kim as â€˜that slutâ€™, the â€˜whore in her husbandâ€™s bedâ€™, a â€˜trampâ€™â€¦ uh huhâ€¦ Sweet irony! She was talking to Bo, Clintâ€™s brother, the man sheâ€™d been having an emotional (almost sexual) relationship with and lying to Clint about it when she said itâ€¦ YIKES! Something about the way Bo and Nora are getting together and the pain itâ€™s causing Clint thatâ€™s causing me to want to root for Clint and Kim (a couple Iâ€™d previously referred to as the reincarnation of Asa and Blair).

Somehow, the writers managed to give Clint and Kim depth. Kim was fixated on her â€˜planâ€™ to get Clint into bed to help him forget Nora. Sheâ€™d treated Clint like a feeble and emotionally dependent â€˜old manâ€™ who would be felled by a little bit of a wiggle and giggle. Kim would have loved Asa â€“ being felled by a wiggle and giggle was more his speed. Clint had already had her investigated. He knew about her stripper past, and didnâ€™t care. He also knew that she thought she was gaming him, and he didnâ€™t care. He knew that her plan to â€˜drink him under the tableâ€™ was about taking advantage of himâ€¦ and he didnâ€™t care because he also knew three other things:

1 â€“ He had the truth on his side and still had the upper hand.

2 â€“ That being involved with the townâ€™s â€˜sainted womanâ€™ isnâ€™t a guarantee that youâ€™ll end up with an honest woman whoâ€™ll treat you well.

3 â€“ That Kim isnâ€™t all bad. Her bark is worse than her bite. Despite the fact that there is a risk of turning Kim into a â€˜hooker with a heart of goldâ€™ stereotype, the writers have so far avoided taking her quite that far.

The storyline seems to be shaping up into one in which the person in need of rescue may be KIM, not Clint. Heâ€™s as intent on using her as she was on using him. I hope that doesnâ€™t happen, because despite my exhaustion with female-male May-December romances, thereâ€™s something about this pairing that I like. Nice touch, writers, on having Kimâ€™s plan fail when she underestimated his ability to hold his liquor. BRAVO for letting Clint walk away despite Kimâ€™s offer to let him spend the night and having him warn her to quit while she was ahead. I could root for them as a couple â€“ with Melissa Archerâ€™s Natalie fighting with Kim and making her work to prove her love for Clint. I could <gulp> just as easily root for them developing a strong father-daughter relationship (Oedipal, I know) or have them remain as good friends. Either way, Iâ€™m hoping to see far more of Clint and Kim than Bo and Nora. SONâ€™s CarlID offered this observation:

Itâ€™s interesting to see the fallout of the Bo and Nora reunion. They were a beloved couple many years ago but not only have times changed, many of the people who were in their lives at that time have changed. Itâ€™s like, what if you reunite a supercopule and no one cheered? I donâ€™t mean the fans, I mean the characters in their lives. You donâ€™t have a lot of people endlessly going, â€œYouâ€™re fated to be together,â€ as you do with many other couples on the show. I also think it would be an interesting writing choice if Matthew wasnâ€™t thrilled they were back together and preferred them apart.

Iâ€™ll add one other observation about this storyline. I found Noraâ€™s reaction to seeing Clint with Kim unusual. Kim was the whore in her husbandâ€™s bed? Why did she care, she was dumping him!?!?! Youâ€™d think sheâ€™d want Clint to find someone, ANYONE to take the heat off of her betrayal of Clint. Is it possible that Nora will wake up and realize that her rekindled love for Bo was based on their mutual concern for Matthew and his health issues? Could Nora wake up and realize that she was happier with Clint than she imagined? What happens then? Where does she turn? Does anyone care?

BTW, folks, is it just me, or did Jerry Ver Dorn make Clint his own with this bend in the storyline? JVDâ€™s left me breathless!

Days of Our Lives

Two words: Carly Manning. Two more words: EPIC FAIL. There are some soap staples I canâ€™t get enough of: scheming liars who are eventually figuratively beaten down and forced to eat their own misery. Bad boys who are only clever by half and outwitted by their victims, victims they eventually fall in love with. Anything to do with corporate intrigue. Good old-fashioned romance.
